title: Alpha Client
body:
Fix your bloody damn client, I was spamming a champion to ban and it wouldn't let me. Then dropped me from the queue and gave me a 30 minute F**KING wait, because of your stupid client.
Why is it, that Riot screws up and we get punished for it.

replies.body:
Freezing, lagging or crashing in champ select then returning the home page is usually a result of a failure to establish a stable connection to the servers. 

Champ Select in all modes requires a more steady connection than the home page as picks (and bans for Draft) are processed in real-time. This is why it's more vulnerable to disconnect there. 

[Troubleshoot your connectivity issues.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/su16_keyart_1920x1080_0.jpg?itok=6nj8mHjj
After selecting a champion you need to confirm the ban. So repeatedly clicking on the champion icon wouldn't have been helpful.
I'm not an idiot, that has been implemented for ages, my wording was rather poor I did say spamming to BAN

The client is in beta.

Its poor optimisation is acknowledged and they're working on fixing it.

**You are not forced to use the beta client, anyone could use the old client (Legacy Client) if they so choose. You simply click the "Launch Legacy Client" at the bottom-right corner of the new launcher, and problem solved.**

????
Same thing happens on the old client as well. It's even worse, always has been. If shits not going to work it might as well look pretty.

THEY HAVE NOT PUT ANY EFFORT INTO FIXING BUGS ON THE OLD CLIENT THOUGH. People don't understand that Riot has put so much time into the new client, that the old client is becoming obsolete and buggy, so some people switch to the new client for a faster experience, but the new client is buggy and not ready to launch. Riot should have finished the new client and THEN released it instead of making them both rubbish.

> [{quoted}](name=Xenoblade,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tAGm8kkl,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-12-19T12:20:49.492+0000)
>
> THEY HAVE NOT PUT ANY EFFORT INTO FIXING BUGS ON THE OLD CLIENT THOUGH. People don't understand that Riot has put so much time into the new client, that the old client is becoming obsolete and buggy, so some people switch to the new client for a faster experience, but the new client is buggy and not ready to launch. Riot should have finished the new client and THEN released it instead of making them both rubbish.

The old client didn't become this optimised as we know it overnight, patches used to be able to crash servers and destroy clients, which massive incidences alone had happened like twice back in those days if I remember correctly, and server used to go down on scheduled weekly (or fortnightly, forgot) maintenance as well and release small patches for clients afterwards. It was due to continuous work over a very long period of time to finally get the Legacy Client running smooth even on toasters, being able to update on-live, and having all sorts of features that wasn't there originally, as well as being mostly bug-free.

It takes time and resources, I don't see them releasing beta client being anything wrong. In fact, it's wrong to release full product without any extended public testing first, because that never works well.

They can release the new client for testing WITHOUT neglecting the old one. Heres my point.

The new one is in BETA and as such is bound to have bugs and problems. So why are they putting no teams onto the problems of the old one? If you pick the old client you expect an older dated but bug free experience for those who don't want to test out a beta mode client. But this isn't the case, Riot isn't doing anything to help the old one.

but that's idealistic, that's now how business works. Shiny > Functional. This is how the world works.

Oh also be careful switching between clients because that can often reset the key bindings you might've set for things and it'll turn quickcast off and auto attack on.

I also like the bit where sometimes the client drops out and closes and won't reopen until you restart the computer if anyone decides to leave during champion select.

Also I find the client bugs out a considerable amount less if you turn on low spec mode in the settings.

Yes your computer should technically be able to handle the fancy new client, yeah you got a fancy 1 or 2gb dedicated graphics and a I5 cpu but trust me for some desktop computers and most laptops, regardless of specs, it'l work alot better in low spec mode.
Same thing happened to me, i sent a report and they sent me back a generic copy pasted message assuming it was firewall settings. Nope, its your client.
bump at least let us authicate
